node.name: Modulators
node.description: External stimuli / interventions or changes in the alertness level (sleep) that modify: the background activity, or how often a graphoelement is occurring, or change other features of the graphoelement (like intra-burst frequency).

node.name: Background-activity
node.description: An EEG activity representing the setting in which a given normal or abnormal pattern appears and from which such pattern is distinguished.

node.name: Posterior-dominant-rhythm
node.description: Rhythmic activity occurring during wakefulness over the posterior regions of the head, generally with maximum amplitudes over the occipital areas. Amplitude varies. Best seen with eyes closed and during physical relaxation and relative mental inactivity. Blocked or attenuated by attention, especially visual, and mental effort. In adults this is the alpha rhythm, and the frequency is 8 to 13 Hz. However the frequency can be higher or lower than this range (often a supra or sub harmonic of alpha frequency) and is called alpha variant rhythm (fast and slow alpha variant rhythm). In children, the normal range of the frequency of the posterior dominant rhythm is age-dependant.

node.name: Mu-rhythm
node.description: EEG rhythm at 7-11 Hz composed of arch-shaped waves occurring over the central or centro-parietal regions of the scalp during wakefulness. Amplitudes varies but is mostly below 50 µV. Blocked or attenuated most clearly by contralateral movement, thought of movement, readiness to move or tactile stimulation.

node.name: Other-organized-rhythms
node.description: EEG activity that consisting of waves of approximately constant period, which is considered as part of the background (ongoing) activity, but does not fulfil the criteria of the posterior dominant rhythm.

node.name: Burst-suppression
node.description: EEG pattern consisting of bursts (activity appearing and disappearing abruptly) interrupted by periods of low amplitude (below 20 µV) and which occurs simultaneously over all head regions.

node.name: Suppression
node.description: Periods showing activity under 10 µV (referential montage) and interrupting the background (ongoing) activity.

node.name: Electrocerebral-inactivity
node.description: Absence of any ongoing cortical electric activities; in all leads EEG is isoelectric or only contains artefacts. Sensitivity has to be increased up to 2 µV/mm; recording time: at least 30 minutes.

node.name: Sleep-drowsiness
node.description: The features of the ongoing activity during sleep are scored here. If abnormal graphoelements appear, disappear or change their morphology during sleep, that is not scored here but at the entry corresponding to that graphooelement (as a modulator).

node.name: Sleep-architecture
node.description: Only to be scored if whole-night sleep is part of the recording. It is a global descriptor of the structure and pattern of sleep: estimation of the amount of time spent in REM and NREM sleep, sleep duration, NREM-REM cycle. Used with Findings-attributes tags

node.name: Sleep-stage-reached
node.description: For normal sleep patterns the sleep stages reached during the recording can be specified

node.name: Sleep-spindles
node.description: Burst at 11-15 Hz but mostly at 12-14 Hz generally diffuse but of higher voltage over the central regions of the head, occurring during sleep. Amplitude varies but is mostly below 50 µV in the adult. Used with Findings-attributes tags

node.name: Vertex-waves
node.description: Sharp potential, maximal at the vertex, negative relative to other areas, apparently occurring spontaneously during sleep or in response to a sensory stimulus during sleep or wakefulness. May be single or repetitive. Amplitude varies but rarely exceeds 250 µV. Abbreviation: V wave. Synonym: vertex sharp wave. Used with Findings-attributes tags

node.name: K-complexes
node.description: A burst of somewhat variable appearance, consisting most commonly of a high voltage negative slow wave followed by a smaller positive slow wave frequently associated with a sleep spindle. Duration greater than 0.5 s. Amplitude is generally maximal in the frontal vertex. K complexes occur during nonREM sleep, apparently spontaneously, or in response to sudden sensory / auditory stimuli, and are not specific for any individual sensory modality. Used with Findings-attributes tags

node.name: POSTS
node.description: Positive occipital sharp transients of sleep. Sharp transient maximal over the occipital regions, positive relative to other areas, apparently occurring spontaneously during sleep. May be single or repetitive. Amplitude varies but is generally bellow 50 µV. Used with Findings-attributes tags

node.name: Hypnagogic-hypersynchrony
node.description: Bursts of bilateral, synchronous delta or theta activity of large amplitude, occasionally with superimposed faster components, occurring during falling asleep or during awakening, in children. Used with Findings-attributes tags

node.name: Non-reactive-sleep
node.description: EEG activity consisting of normal sleep graphoelemts, but which cannot be interrupted by external stimuli/ the patient cannot be waken. Used with Findings-attributes tags

node.name: Interictal-findings
node.description: EEG patterns / transients that are distinguished form the background activity, considered abnormal, but are not recorded during ictal period (seizure) or postictal period; the presence of interictal findings does not necessarily imply that the patient has epilepsy.

node.name: Burst-suppression
node.description: ? How is it different from tag in Background-activity?

node.name: Burst-attenuation
node.description: ? How is it different from tag in Background-activity?

node.name: Physiologic-patterns
node.description: EEG graphoelements or rhythms that are considered normal. They only should be scored if the physician considers that they have a specific clinical significance for the recording.

node.name: Uncertain-significance-patterns
node.description: EEG graphoelements or rhythms that resemble abnormal patterns but that are not necessarily associated with a pathology, and the physician does not consider them abnormal in the context of the scored recording (like normal variants and patterns).

node.name: EEG-artifacts
node.description: When relevant for the clinical interpretation, artifacts can be scored by specifying the type and the location.

node.name: Polygraphic-channels
node.description: Changes observed in polygraphic channels can be scored: EOG, Respiration, ECG, EMG, other polygraphic channel (+ free text), and their significance logged (normal, abnormal, no definite abnormality).

node.name: Duration
node.description: An offset that is implicit after duration time passed from the onset.

node.name: Delta-activity
node.description: EEG rhythm in the delta (under 4 Hz) range that does not belong to the posterior dominant rhythm (scored under other organised rhythms). Used with Amplitude tag

node.name: Theta-activity
node.description: EEG rhythm in the theta (4-8 Hz) range that does not belong to the posterior dominant rhythm (scored under other organised rhythms). Used with Amplitude tag

node.name: Alpha-activity
node.description: EEG rhythm in the alpha range (8-13 Hz) which is considered part of the background (ongoing) activity but does not fulfil the criteria of the posterior dominant rhythm (alpha rhythm). Used with Amplitude tag

node.name: Beta-activity
node.description: EEG rhythm between 14 and 40 Hz, which is considered part of the background (ongoing) activity but does not fulfil the criteria of the posterior dominant rhythm. Most characteristically: a rhythm from 14 to 40 Hz recorded over the fronto-central regions of the head during wakefulness. Amplitude of the beta rhythm varies but is mostly below 30 µV. Other beta rhythms are most prominent in other locations or are diffuse. Used with Amplitude tag

node.name: Spike
node.description: A transient, clearly distinguished from background activity, with pointed peak at a conventional paper speed or time scale and duration from 20 to under 70 ms, i.e. 1/50-1/15 s approximately. Main component is generally negative relative to other areas. Amplitude varies.

node.name: Spike-and-slow-wave
node.description: A pattern consisting of a spike followed by a slow wave.

node.name: Runs-of-rapid-spikes
node.description: Bursts of spike discharges at a rate from 10 to 25/sec (in most cases somewhat irregular). The bursts last more than 2 seconds (usually 2 to 10 seconds) and it is typically seen in sleep. Synonyms: rhythmic spikes, generalized paroxysmal fast activity, fast paroxysmal rhythms, grand mal discharge, fast beta activity

node.name: Polyspike-and-slow-wave
node.description: Two or more consecutive spikes associated with one or more slow waves.

node.name: Sharp-wave
node.description: A transient clearly distinguished from background activity, with pointed peak at a conventional paper speed or time scale, and duration of 70-200 ms, i.e. over ¼-1/5 s approximately. Main component is generally negative relative to other areas. Amplitude varies.

node.name: Sharp-and-slow-wave
node.description: A sequence of a sharp wave and a slow wave.

node.name: Slow-sharp-wave
node.description: A transient that bears all the characteristics of a sharp-wave, but exceeds 200 ms. Synonym: blunted sharp wave.

node.name: Polymorphic-delta
node.description: EEG activity consisting of waves in the delta range (over 250 ms duration for each wave) but of different morphology.

node.name: FIRDA
node.description: Frontal intermittent rhythmic delta activity. Fairly regular or approximately sinusoidal waves, mostly occurring in bursts at 1.5-2.5 Hz over the frontal areas of one or both sides of the head. Comment: most commonly associated with unspecified encephalopathy, in adults.

node.name: OIRDA
node.description: Occipital intermittent rhythmic delta activity. Fairly regular or approximately sinusoidal waves, mostly occurring in bursts at 2-3 Hz over the occipital or posterior head regions of one or both sides of the head. Frequently blocked or attenuated by opening the eyes. Comment: most commonly associated with unspecified encephalopathy, in children

node.name: TIRDA
node.description: Temporal intermittent rhythmic delta activity. Fairly regular or approximately sinusoidal waves, mostly occurring in bursts at over the temporal areas of one side of the head. Comment: most commonly associated with temporal lobe epilepsy.

node.name: Source-analysis
node.description: ? Look in the papaers how is this different from location as there are more options but seems the same...

node.name: Sensors
node.description: lists all corresponding sensors (electrodes/channels in montage)

node.name: Modulators-property
node.description: For each described graphoelement, the influence of the modulators can be scored. Only modulators present in the recording are scored.

node.name: Eye-closure-sensitivity
node.description: Eye closure sensitivity. Used with Findings-attributes tags

node.name: Eye-opening-passive
node.description: Passive eye opening. Used with Findings-attributes tags

node.name: Medication-effect
node.description: Medications effect on EEG. Used with Findings-attributes tags

node.name: Medication-reduction-effect
node.description: Medications reduction or withdrawl effect on EEG. Used with Findings-attributes tags

node.name: Modulators-effect
node.description: Tags for describing the influence of the modulators
Only during Sleep/Awakening/Hyperventilation/Physical effort/Cognitive task. Free text

node.name: Time-related-features-property
node.description: Important to estimate how often an interictal abnormality is seen in the recording.

node.name: Appearance-mode
node.description: Describes how the non-ictal EEG patern/graphoelement is distributed through the recording

node.name: Random
node.description: Occurrence of the the non-ictal EEG pattern / graphoelement without any rhytmicity / periodicity

node.name: Periodic
node.description: Non-ictal EEG pattern / graphoelement occurring at an approximately regular rate / interval (generally of 1 to several seconds).

node.name: Variable
node.description: Occurrence of non-ictal EEG pattern / graphoelements, that is sometimes rhythmic or periodic, other times random, throughout the recording

node.name: Discharge-patern
node.description: Describes the organization of the EEG signal within the discharge (distinguish between single and repetitive discharges)

node.name: Single-discharge
node.description: Applies to the intra-burst pattern: a graphoelement that is not repetitive; before and after the graphoelement one can distinguish the background activity. Used with Findings-attributes tags

node.name: Rhythmic-trains-or-bursts
node.description: Applies to the intra-burst pattern: a non-ictal graphoelement that repeats itself without returning to the background activity between them. The graphoelements within this repetition occur at approximately constant period. Used with Findings-attributes tags

node.name: Arhythmic-trains-or-bursts
node.description: Applies to the intra-burst pattern: a non-ictal graphoelement that repeats itself without returning to the background activity between them. The graphoelements within this repetition occur at inconstant period. Used with Findings-attributes tags

node.name: PDR-Amplitude-asymmetry
node.description: A difference in amplitude between the homologous area on opposite sides of the head that consistently exceeds 50 percent. Used with Asymmetry tags

node.name: PDR-Eye-opening
node.description: Change (disappearance or measurable decrease in amplitude) of a posterior dominant rhythm following eye-opening. Eye closure has the opposite effect. Used with Findings-attributes tags

node.name: Prevalence
node.description: the percentage of the recording covered by the train/burst

node.name: Extent
node.description: percentage of occurrence during the recording

schemaAttributeDefinition.name: allowedCharacter
schemaAttributeDefinition.description: An attribute of unit classes schema value placeholders indicating a special character that is allowed in expressing the value of that placeholder.

schemaAttributeDefinition.name: defaultUnits
schemaAttributeDefinition.description: An attribute of unit classes specifying the default units for a tag.

schemaAttributeDefinition.name: extensionAllowed
schemaAttributeDefinition.description: Users can add unlimited levels of child nodes under this tag.

schemaAttributeDefinition.name: isNumeric
schemaAttributeDefinition.description: The tag hashtag placeholder must be replaced by a numerical value.

schemaAttributeDefinition.name: position
schemaAttributeDefinition.description: Used to specify the order of the required and recommended tags in canonical order for display. The position attribute value should be an integer and the order can start at 0 or 1. Required or recommended tags without this attribute or with negative position will be shown after the others in canonical ordering.

schemaAttributeDefinition.name: predicateType
schemaAttributeDefinition.description: One of propertyOf, subclassOf, passThrough -- used to facilitate mapping to OWL or RDF.

schemaAttributeDefinition.name: recommended
schemaAttributeDefinition.description: A HED string tagging an event is recommended to include this tag.

schemaAttributeDefinition.name: relatedTag
schemaAttributeDefinition.description: Additional HED tags suggested to be used with this tag. This attribute is used by tagging tools.

schemaAttributeDefinition.name: requireChild
schemaAttributeDefinition.description: One of its descendants must be chosen to tag an event.

schemaAttributeDefinition.name: required
schemaAttributeDefinition.description: Every HED string tagging an event should include this tag.

schemaAttributeDefinition.name: SIUnit
schemaAttributeDefinition.description: Designates the name of an SI unit so it can be modified by multiple and submultiple names. Note that some units such as byte are designated as SI units although they are not part of the standard.

schemaAttributeDefinition.name: SIUnitModifier
schemaAttributeDefinition.description: SI unit modifier indicating a multiple or submultiple of a base unit.

schemaAttributeDefinition.name: SIUnitSymbolModifier
schemaAttributeDefinition.description: SI unit symbol modifier indicating a multiple or submultiple of a base unit symbol.

schemaAttributeDefinition.name: suggestedTag
schemaAttributeDefinition.description: Additional HED tags suggested to be used with this tag. This attribute is used by tagging tools.

schemaAttributeDefinition.name: takesValue
schemaAttributeDefinition.description: This tag will have a hashtag placeholder child in the schema which is expected to be replaced with a user-defined value.

schemaAttributeDefinition.name: unique
schemaAttributeDefinition.description: Only one of this tag or its descendants can be used within a single tag group or event.

schemaAttributeDefinition.name: unitSymbol
schemaAttributeDefinition.description: Abbreviation or symbol representing a type of unit. Unit symbols represent both the singular and the plural and thus cannot be pluralized.

schemaAttributeDefinition.name: unitClass
schemaAttributeDefinition.description: Specifies the type of a unit for a tag.
